Practical aspects of biowastes conversion to fertilizers

abstracts.content: The paper presents different aspects of biomass-based fertilizer production along with technological challenges, relevant law – the European Union guidelines concerning renewable resources, in particular bio-based wastes valorization for fertilizer purposes – and products introduction to the market. Fertilizer technology employs different types of biosolids: sewage sludge, ashes from sewage sludge, agricultural residues, and food waste. Organo-mineral fertilizers can be formulated from different mass streams of biological origin: biomass processed by biological conversion (aerobic or anaerobic), chemical conditioning (acids or alkali), or thermal processes (combustion, pyrolysis). Through a combination of different types of processed biomass (e.g., biosolids conditioned with mineral acid can be neutralized and granulated with ashes from the biomass combustion) and by composition correction, it is possible to produce organic-mineral fertilizers. Particular attention was paid to relevant law (agriculture and non-agricultural applications) and technological problems such as large-scale installations. The available fertilizer production technologies constitute a part of the concept of bio-based circular economy, which in turn could lead to sustainable development as envisioned by the new European Green Deal strategy.

results.title: RATOWNICTWO MEDYCZNE W POLSCE. ZARYS HOLI-SYSTEMU

abstracts.content: <jats:p>Ratownictwo medyczne w Polsce to więcej niż jedynie funkcjonowanie systemu Państwowe RatownictwoMedyczne. Współczesne uwarunkowania bezpieczeństwa narodowego RP skłaniają kuposzukiwaniu całościowej (holistycznej) formuły systemu ratownictwa medycznego w Polsce. Zacel badań przyjęto implementację koncepcji holi-systemu bezpieczeństwa na grunt problematykiratownictwa medycznego w Polsce. Dokonano tego poprzez określenie elementów konstytutywnychsystemu ratownictwa medycznego w Polsce (misji i celów, elementów i źródeł relacji systemowych),a także określenie ogólnych relacji systemu ratownictwa medycznego w Polsce z wybranymisystemami szczegółowymi systemu bezpieczeństwa narodowego RP. Badanie naukoweprzeprowadzono w oparciu o studiowanie literatury przedmiotu. Udowodniono, że holistycznaformuła systemu ratownictwa medycznego w Polsce wykracza poza struktury systemu PaństwoweRatownictwo Medyczne. Uwidacznia się to w odniesieniu do misji, celów, elementów i źródeł relacjiporządkujących systemowe ratownictwo medyczne w Polsce. Znajduje swoje potwierdzeniew zależnościach łączących system ratownictwa medycznego w Polsce z innymi komponentamisystemu bezpieczeństwa narodowego RP.</jats:p>

results.title: Understanding of the stability of acyclic nitronic acids in the light of molecular electron density theory

journal.title: Journal of Molecular Graphics and Modelling

abstracts.content: In the present work, the electronic structure and stability of acyclic nitronic acids were studied. Depending on the different substituents, the analyzed compounds can be classified as pseudo(mono)radical or zwitterionic nitronic acids. ELF topological analysis of the electron density of nitronic acids containing in their structure EWG substituent (-NO2 (1); –COOCH3 (2); –NO2, –CH3 (5); –COOCH3, –OCH3 (6); –NO2, –H (7); –COOH3, –H (8)) permits establishing a pseudo(mono)radical electronic structure with a pseudoradical centers at the C1 carbon atom. In turn, ELF analysis of the compounds 3, 4, 9 and 10 containing substituent belonging to the EGD group (-CH3 (3); –OCH3 (4); –CH3, –H (9); –COH3, –H (10)) and based on the presence of C1–N2 double bond and absence of pseudoradical centre allows for the classification of these compounds as a zwitterionic nitronic acids. Nitronic acids containing EDG substituents in their structure are the most stable among the analyzed nitronic acids. In turn, nitronic acids containing EWG groups are characterized by higher reactivity in chemical reactions compared to other analyzed nitronic acids.

Insights into the nature of Zr-species in MFI-type Zr-metallosilicates by using bulk and surface techniques

abstracts.content: The purpose of this study is to prepare Zr-metallosilicates with MFI-type framework via direct hydrothermal approach, by varying Si and Zr precursors. First, a set of routine characterization techniques was applied to confirm the presence of the targeted structure as well as their intrinsic properties. Results suggest the formation of MFI-type materials with large specific surface areas (up to 421 m2 g−1). Then, a combination of advanced spectroscopic techniques (XPS, ToF-SIMS, EPR), high-resolution microscopy, and periodic Density Functional Theory (DFT) calculations were applied to study their bulk and surface properties as well as the nature and localization of Zr-species. It appears that the insertion of zirconium atoms within a MFI framework is energetically unfavorable, leading to the formation of an amorphous silica-zirconia shell coating the zeolite crystals.

results.title: Literatura i życie literackie na łamach "Dziennika Bałtyckiego" w latach 1945-1956
Efficiency and capacity of nanoporous solids subjected to periodic disturbances of concentration

abstracts.content:
The dynamics of zeolite crystals and nanoporous glass pellets exposed to periodic disturbances of concentration
was investigated. Three binary gas mixtures were employed for numerical simulations: {CO2, C3H8}, {H2, CO2}
and {H2, n-C4H10}. The work addressed two objectives. At first, based on IAS theory, a method was proposed for
predictive approximation of thermodynamic factors Γij depending on the composition of the adsorbed phase.
Secondly, the method was further utilized to analyze the dynamics of selected nanoporous materials subjected to
periodic disturbances of concentration. It was assumed that diffusion takes place in: porous Vycor glass pellet
with a pore diameter of dp = 4⋅10-9 m, in silicalite-1 and in zeolite MFI with a ratio of Si/Al = 139. The concept of
diffusive permeability was used for interpretation of the results. The relationship between the responses to step
and sinusoidal forcing was demonstrated. For {CO2, C3H8} and {H2, CO2} diffusion systems, step forcing produced greater selectivity than periodic forcing. However, for strongly adsorbing components that exhibit a low
diffusion rate, e.g. {H2, n-C4H10}, time intervals emerged for which periodic forcing resulted in greater selectivity
than step forcing, which may have practical applicability.

results.title: O potrzebie moralności życia publicznego
Społecznościowa aplikacja mobilna z użyciem autorskiego algorytmu dopasowującego opartego na filtracji kolaboratywnej

abstracts.content:
W artykule zaprezentowano autorską aplikację mobilną o nazwie Utibi. Głównym celem aplikacji Utibi jest pomoc w szukaniu i łączeniu ludzi
o podobnych zainteresowaniach i aktywnościach oraz nawiązywanie nowych znajomości i relacji. Utibi opiera się na nowoczesnych technologiach
wykorzystanych do zarządzania relacjami społecznymi. Każdy użytkownik aplikacji opisany jest zestawem cech osobowości, mocnych stron, wartości,
zainteresowań oraz rzeczy, nad którymi chce popracować. Nowością naukową jest implementacja autorskiego algorytmu dopasowującego opartego na
zmodyfikowanej wersji filtracji kolaboratywnej. Zadaniem algorytmu jest skuteczne dopasowywanie i łączenie grup osób o podobnych cechach i potrzebach
zgodnie z aktualną wiedzą psychologiczną.

The article presents a proprietary mobile application named Utibi. The main goal of the Utibi app is to assist in finding and connecting
people with similar interests and activities, as well as forming new friendships and relationships. Utibi relies on modern technologies used for
managing social relationships. Every user of the application is described by a set of personality traits, strengths, values, interests, and things they
want to improve on. The scientific novelty is the implementation of a proprietary matching algorithm based on a modified version of collaborative
filtering. The task of the algorithm is to effectively match and connect groups of people with similar characteristics and needs according to current
psychological knowledge.

book.title: Aesthetics of law: from methodology to manifestations

results.title: Law and literature: a new view from six perspectives

abstracts.content: The paper aims to introduce new areas where law and literature interact. "Law on literature" view focuses on regulations concerning literary creativity. "Literature in law" theory explores situations, where references to literature are made within legal texts. "Literature as law" perspective derives from historic adapting literature into law. "Legal literature" develops the idea of "law in literature" specifically applying it to juristic works. Literary theorists tend to divide texts for these of practical purpose and those created for spiritual reasons. Authors do not share that opinion and emphasize the significance of exploring humanistic values carried within law.

results.title: Trakowie w literaturze starożytnych Greków. Od typu do stereotypu

abstracts.content: W literaturze greckiej postacie Traków były reprezentowane przez typowe cechy. I tak archaiczna poezja epicka i liryczna dostarczyła nam obraz „barbarzyńcy”, a raczej nie-Greka, bez wyraźnie pejoratywnego wydźwięku. Tracja kojarzyła się Grekom przede wszystkim z muzyką (Orfeusz), sztuką wojenną i hodowlą koni. Archaiczna poezja epicka i liryczna nadawała zatem obraz „barbarzyńcy”, a raczej nie-Greka, bez wyraźnie pejoratywnego wydźwięku. Ale oprócz Aresa Trakowie szczególnym szacunkiem darzyli także Dionizosa. Słynęli nie tylko z doskonałego wina ismaryjskiego, ale także z jego nadużywania. Już od czasów archaicznych Grecy oskarżali Traków o pijaństwo (por. Archiloch). Szybko stało się to cechą stereotypową, podobnie jak niepohamowana pobudliwość seksualna i nieuczciwość. Ten stereotyp etniczny w połączeniu z prozopografią (niebieskie oczy i rude włosy) był szeroko stosowany w greckiej komedii. Schemat ten częściowo burzy Ksenofont, który Seutesowi nie nadał a priori cech stereotypowych, choć ostatecznie zastosował on w odniesieniu do owej postaci sokratejski wzorzec moralności.

In Greek literature, the characters of the Thracians were represented by typical
features. And so archaic epic and lyrical poetry gave us the image of a “barbarian”, or rather a non-Greek, without clearly pejorative overtones. Thrace was associated by the Greeks primarily with music (Orpheus), the art of war and horse breeding.Thus, archaic epic and lyrical poetry gave us the image of a “barbarian”, or rather a non-Greek, without clearly pejorative overtones. Thrace was associated by the Greeks primarily with music (Orpheus), the art of war and horse breeding. But apart from Ares, the Thracians also had a special reverence for Dionysus. They were famous not only for the excellent Ismarian wine, but also for its abuse. The Greeks accused the Thracians of drunkenness from archaic times (cf. Archilochus). This quickly became a stereotypical feature, as did unbridled sexual excitability and dishonesty.This ethnic stereotype plus prosopography (blue eyes and red hair) were used extensively in Greek comedy. This scheme is partly destroyed by Xenophon, who did not endow Seuthes with stereotypical features a priori, although he eventually applied the Socratic pattern of morality to his character.

book.title: Polish as a foreign and second language among Ukrainian migrants

results.title: A case study - The work of a Polish teacher on developing the vocabulary of a student with a migration experience in the perspective of intercomprehension

abstracts.content:
Intercomprehension allows students and teachers of multilingual classrooms to understand each other in everyday school communication, but the work of a Polish language teacher teaching Polish in a multilingual classroom is not enough. Knowledge and linguistic awareness are needed, as well as adequate didactic competence. Planning such
difficult didactic work requires prior diagnosis and recognition of the difficulties faced by the student and the teacher. An element of such diagnosis is the written work of students. For Polish teachers who do not know Russian, they generate many difficulties, especially at the level of word comprehension. Investigating the strategies of dealing with incomprehensible words by Polish and Polish studies students allows us to see the problems of teaching vocabulary of the second language and to propose didactic solutions.

results.title: Perception of the relationship between the phenomenon of indulgent and luxury goods consumption

abstracts.content: Luksus jest pojęciem subiektywnym, interpretowanym przez pryzmat wielu, często bardzo osobistych zmiennych. Produkty luksusowe zaspokajają wyższe potrzeby, ich nabycie jest motywowane chęcią manifestacji wysokiego statusu społecznego, dostarczania przyjemności, a nie eliminacji dyskomfortu, jak to często ma miejsce w przypadku produktów masowych. Jednym z powodów nabywania dóbr luksusowych jest pragnienie konsumentów, aby sobie dogodzić. Celem artykułu jest ocena, w jakim stopniu luksus i produkty luksusowe są związane z zjawiskiem dogadzania sobie, co motywuje oba te zachowania, i jaki jest stosunek konsumentów do nich. Aby osiągnąć ten cel, przeprowadzono analizę literatury na temat konsumpcji luksusowej i zachowań związanych z dogadzaniem sobie, jak również badania nad tymi zjawiskami. Przeprowadzono również badanie za pomocą wywiadów grupowych. Badanie zostało przeprowadzone wśród polskich respondentów, ale jest to wstępny krok do dalszych, pogłębionych badań w międzynarodowym zespole.

Luxury is a subjective concept, interpreted through the prism of many, often very personal variables. Luxury products satisfy higher needs, their acquisition is motivated by the desire to manifest high social status, to provide pleasure, not to eliminate discomfort as is often the case with mass products. One of the reasons for acquiring luxury goods is consumers' desire to indulge themselves.
The aim of the article is to assess the extent to which luxury and luxury products are associated with the phenomenon of indulgence, what motivates both behaviors, and what is consumers' attitude towards them. To achieve this goal, an analysis of the literature on luxury consumption and indulgent behaviors, as well as research findings on these phenomena, was conducted. A study using Focus Group Interviews was also carried out. The research was conducted among Polish respondents, but it is a preliminary step to further, in-depth studies in an international team.

The hermeneutic paradox: The secret power of education as self-education

journal.title: Studies on the Theory of Education

abstracts.content: The dialectic of power is one of the fundamental questions of pedagogy. Recognizing that power is a multidimensional phenomenon that manifests itself differently in different contexts, a number of disciplines and paradigms have exposed the dynamics of power at work in pedagogy and in the broader social and cultural contexts of education. A hermeneutic approach to power seeks to cultivate sensitivity and attunement to the interpretive experience of power as a lifelong and collective endeavor of (self-)education. Different situations of detecting, interpreting, critiquing, exercising, accepting, and resisting various manifestations of power in our lives all call for engaging in (self-)education as a constant seeking for the right measure, as a permanent formation (Bildung) to discernment, conversation, and responsibility. Learning and teaching to live with and think about power is an essential way of being in the world with ourselves and Others. The international, collaborative research project “Philosophy, Education, Power, and Violence” exhibited in this journal brings together diverse reflections and case studies on the dialectic of power in the spirit of fostering hermeneutic synodality as a model for the empowering experience of (self-)education.

results.title: Children’s Vegetarian Culture in the Victorian Era: The Juvenile Food Reformers Press and Literary Change

abstracts.content:
This book fills a unique gap in the research on the cultural history of vegetarianism and veganism, children's literature and Victorian periodicals, and it is the first publication to systematically describe the phenomenon of Victorian children’s vegetarianism and its representations in literature and culture.

Situated in the broad socio-literary context spanning the late nineteenth century and early twentieth century, the book lays the groundwork for contemporary children’s vegan literature and argues that present ethical and environmental concerns can be traced back to the Victorian period. Following the current turn in contemporary research on children, their experience and their voices, the author examines children’s vegetarian culture through the prism of the periodicals aimed directly at them. It analyses how vegetarian principles were communicated to children and listens to the voices of children who were vegetarians, and who tested their newly formed identity in the pages of three magazines published between 1893 and 1914: The Daisy Basket, The Children’s Garden and The Children’s Realm.

This book will appeal to the growing body of researchers interested in the social, cultural and literary aspects of vegetarianism and veganism, human–animal relations, childhood studies, children’s literature, periodical studies and Victorian studies.

Blockchain and traceability of geographical indication products

abstracts.content: System identyfikowalności produktów odgrywa znaczącą rolę w łańcuchu dostaw żywności, za-pewniając  bezpieczeństwo  poprzez  monitorowanie  ryzyka  i  jakości  żywności.  System  ten  jest  gwarancją, że wszystkie etapy spełniają wymagania co do specyfikacji i jakości produktów. Iden-tyfikowalność produktów ma również duże znaczenie dla produktów chronionych oznaczeniem geograficznym, gdyż potwierdza autentyczność tych produktów, wskazuje na ich pochodzenie, a co za tym idzie, zapobiega ich podrabianiu. Jednak system ten musi być wydajny i posiadać odpowiednie  zabezpieczenia.  Korzystanie  z  technologii  blockchain  w  systemie  identyfikowal-ności produktów może sprawić, że systemy te będą niemalże doskonałe.

Traceability plays a significant role in food supply chains by ensuring food safety through piloting risks  and  quality.  It  helps  to  ensure  that  all  production  steps  meet  specification  and  quality  requirements. It is also a very important tool for geographical indication products as it proves the authenticity of products, indicates their origin and, consequently, prevents counterfeiting. The  system  must  be  efficient  and  have  anti-tampering  features.  Using  blockchain  technology  can render these systems nearly perfect.

results.title: Inland transport enterprises process maturity assessment - theoretical aspects

abstracts.content:
Kluczową funkcją przedsiębiorstw transportu śródlądowego jest ekspansywny rozwój w ramach globalnego łańcucha dostaw kontenerów morskich. Odpowiedzialność za zarządzanie lądowymi segmentami łańcucha dostaw, w połączeniu z podmiotami wpływającymi na segment morski, przyczynia się do wzrostu poziomu integracji i koordynacji całego łańcucha dostaw. Skuteczność procesów realizowanych w ramach różnych działań w całym łańcuchu dostaw ma zasadnicze znaczenie dla określenia atrakcyjności i przewagi konkurencyjnej poszczególnych uczestników jak i dla całego łańcucha dostaw. Ze względu na szerokie spektrum zadań i obowiązków spoczywających na przedsiębiorstwach transportu lądowego podkreśla się konieczność przyjęcia procesowego systemu zarządzania. Dojrzałość procesowa stanowi układ, w której poszczególne procesy są sformalizowane pod względem ich definicji, identyfikacji, pomiaru, adaptowalności i wydajności. Niestety, w literaturze brakuje modeli dojrzałości procesowej mających zastosowanie w przedsiębiorstwach transportu lądowego. Celem niniejszego opracowania jest zatem zbudowanie teoretycznego modelu oceny dojrzałości procesowej w podmiotach transportu lądowego.
Aby osiągnąć ten cel, w badaniu zastosowano kilka metodologii badawczych, w tym przegląd istniejącej literatury, metodę kwestionariuszową i model oceny dojrzałości procesu.
Wyniki badań pozwalają stwierdzić, że proponowany model oceny dojrzałości procesowej przedsiębiorstw transportu lądowego jest podzielony na różne poziomy i wymiary, co zapewnia poprawny wgląd w proces zwiększania dojrzałości procesowej w badanych przedsiębiorstwach.
Zaproponowany model dojrzałości procesowej przedsiębiorstw transportu lądowego może znaleźć zastosowanie w praktyce jako model referencyjny, który menedżerowie będą mogli wykorzystać do celów benchmarkingu, a także sformułowania zestawu rekomendacji (najlepszych praktyk).

The critical function of inland transport enterprises within the expansive domain of the global maritime container supply chain is acknowledged. The responsibility for managing terrestrial segments of the supply chain, in conjunction with the multifaceted entities impacting the maritime segment, contributes to the complexity of integrating and coordinating the entire supply chain. The effectiveness of processes executed in various activities across the supply chain is instrumental in determining the allure and competitive edge of specific participants and the supply chain at large. Owing to the broad spectrum of tasks and obligations bestowed upon inland transport companies, the necessity for adopting an apt process-oriented management system is underscored. Process maturity is characterized by a framework in which individual processes are formalized in terms of their definition, identification, measurement, adaptability, and efficiency. Regrettably, the literature evidences a dearth of process maturity models applicable to inland transport firms. Thus, the aim of this study is to introduce a theoretical framework for assessing process maturity in inland transport entities.
To meet this aim, the investigation employed several research methodologies, including a review of existing literature, the questionnaire method, and a process maturity evaluation model.
The reseach findings allow to state thet the proposed process maturity assessment model for inland transport companies is segmented into various levels and dimensions, offering enhanced insights into the augmentation of process maturity within enterprises.
The proposed process maturity model for inland transport enterprises can be applied in practice as a reference model that managers might utilize for benchmarking purposes, as well as a compilation of recommendations (best practices).

results.title: What Does Pricelessness Mean?

abstracts.content: The goal of this text is to elaborate the notion of pricelessness. The issue of pricelessness is distinguished from other important points in the Moral Limits of Markets debate. The proposition of the meaning of pricelessness is presented and discussed. I argue that the notion of pricelessness should not be identified with the notion of dignity or the highest value. The value which is a basis for the pricelessness claim does not have to be a moral value, the notion of pricelessness functions at the crossroads between different kinds of values (moral, aesthetic, scientific, sentimental, commercial etc.). I argue that the core intuition associated with pricelessness refers to the incomparability of values. It is expressed as being price-less because money is seen as a universal comparator - it has a potential to translate any other values. Further, I distinguish three models of relation between commercial and priceless realms, named as: 1) contamination model, 2) contractual model, and 3) contextual model, in order to show that the attitudes toward the intuition that pricing itself may corrupt intrinsic values, depends on the presuppositions one shares. I argue that the conviction about corrupting force of money might be also explained by the intuitive concerns related to purity and degradation under Moral Foundations Theory. Using Radin's concepts, I claim that both non-commodities and incomplete commodities might be meaningfully called priceless. Finally, I recognize the limits of the argument from pricelessness and admit that it is rarely strong enough in itself to justify prohibition of commodification.

book.title: Handbook on cyber hate: the modern cyber evil

results.title: Online hate speech under international law

abstracts.content: The term “hate speech” has not been conventionally defined thus far, namely in the international human rights law. The aim of this paper is to set forth the significance of “hate speech” in general and “online hate speech” (aka cyberhate) in particular under international law. This study primarily analyzes the binding provisions of international human rights law such as the International Covenant on Civil and Political Rights and the International Convention on the Elimination of All Forms of Racial Discrimination. Therefore, it pays attention to the standards to consider an action as a “hate speech”. This study brings us to the final conclusion that despite the general framework within international law, the harm caused by cyberhate differs significantly from offline hate, and thus requires distinctive regulations. Therefore, it is necessary to discuss cyberhate within international community and to adopt measures with this regard.

results.title: Polyethylene Glycol/Pullulan-based carrier for silymarin delivery and its potential in biomedical applications

abstracts.content:
Restoring the structures and functions of tissues along with organs in human bodies is a
topic gathering attention nowadays. These issues are widely discussed in the context of regenerative
medicine. Excipients/delivery systems play a key role in this topic, guaranteeing a positive impact on
the effectiveness of the drugs or therapeutic substances supplied. Advances in materials engineering,
particularly in the development of hydrogel biomaterials, have influenced the idea of creating an
innovative material that could serve as a carrier for active substances while ensuring biocompatibility
and meeting all the stringent requirements imposed on medical materials. This work presents the
preparation of a natural polymeric material based on pullulan modified with silymarin, which belongs
to the group of flavonoids and derives from a plant called Silybum marianum. Under UV light, matrices
with a previously prepared composition were crosslinked. Before proceeding to the next stage of
the research, the purity of the composition of the matrices was checked using Fourier-transform
infrared (FT-IR) spectroscopy. Incubation tests lasting 19 days were carried out using incubation
fluids such as simulated body fluid (SBF), Ringer’s solution, and artificial saliva. Changes in pH,
electrolytic conductivity, and weight were observed and then used to determine the sorption capacity.
During incubation, SBF proved to be the most stable fluid, with a pH level of 7.6–7.8. Sorption tests
showed a high sorption capacity of samples incubated in both Ringer’s solution and artificial saliva
(approximately 350%) and SBF (approximately 300%). After incubation, the surface morphology was
analyzed using an optical microscope for samples demonstrating the greatest changes over time. The
active substance, silymarin, was released using a water bath, and then the antioxidant capacity was
determined using the Folin–Ciocâlteu test. The tests carried out proved that the material produced
is active and harmless, which was shown by the incubation analysis. The continuous release of
the active ingredient increases the biological value of the biomaterial. The material requires further
research, including a more detailed assessment of its balance; however, it demonstrates promising
potential for further experiments.

results.title: Art in Poland Immediately after the War in Search of Social Context
The impact of ambidexterity on robotic process automation implementation strategy in service enterprises

abstracts.content:
Robotic Process Automation (RPA) has gained increasing significance in recent years. RPA leverages software bots
to automate repetitive business processes traditionally performed by humans, making it one of the easiest, least
invasive, and fastest automation approaches. Publications on the topic are scarce, however, and concerns regarding
job loss and employee acceptance of new operational processes and technologies remain significant challenges.
The additional motivation behind this study is to address the lack of research on the implementation strategy of RPA
in the context of ambidexterity, i.e., optimizing enterprise capability in balancing between exploration and exploitation.
The paper adopts a managerial perspective and aims to identify the key factors supporting the implementation
of RPA in the context of ambidexterity, using an empirical study of service companies as an example. The research
methodology employed includes literature review, opinion surveys, and statistical analysis. The paper highlights
the stimulating role of the ambidexterity concept in RPA implementation projects and strategies, with a hybrid
approach to dynamic balancing of exploitation and exploration. The findings of this paper will be of use for researchers and practitioners in developing effective RPA implementation strategies that balance the needs for exploitation and exploration while factoring in the concerns raised by employees.

results.title: Dwaj święci Aleksandra Kuprina: studium przypadku

abstracts.content: Aleksander Kuprin uważany jest za wnikliwego, mądrego obserwatora ludzkiego zycia, mistrza w ukazywaniu rozmaitych charakterów i przedstawicieli różnych grup społecznych, pisarza, który jest zdolny do przekraczania granic literackich konwencji w celu ukazania fundamentalnych prawd ludzkiej egzystencji. Opowiadanie "Dwaj święci' dowodzi słuszności tych spostrzeżen. Jego główni bohaterowie to Mikołaj, biskup Myr Licyjskich oraz Jan Kasjan.Podążając za rosyjską ludową legendą, A. Kuprin ukazuje ich wspólną wędrówkę do Nieba, mistrzowsko przybliża czytelnikowi obu starożytnych świętych oraz ukazuje różne drogi prowadzące do Boga, Którego Sprawiedliwość jest Miłosierdziem.

Aleksandr Kuprin is considered to be a penetrating and wise observer of human life, admirer of colourful characters which represent different social groups, a writer who is able to transgress the borderlines of literary conventions in order to reveal fundamental  truthes  of  the  human  existence.  The  tale  Two  saints  proves  these  statements to be true. Its main heroes are Nicholas, bishop of Myra and John Cassian. Following the plot of the Russian folk legend, A. Kuprin depicts their journey in common to the Heavens, skilfully approximates both ancient saints to his reader and demonstrates different ways that lead to God, whose Justice is Mercy.

results.title: University students’ strategies of coping with stress: complementary study two years after the beginning of COVID-19 pandemic

abstracts.content:
Celem artykułu jest przedstawienie wyników badania dotyczącego strategii radzenia sobie ze stresem
wśród studentów polskich uczelni pod koniec pandemii COVID-19, czyli na początku 2022 roku. W badaniach wykorzystano kwestionariusz Mini-COPE, który wypełniło 475 studentów polskich uczelni. Zgromadzony materiał empiryczny wykazał, że w 2022 r. respondenci częściej stosowali strategie takie jak
humor i obwinianie się, natomiast częstotliwość stosowania strategii religijnych okazała się niższa
w porównaniu z badaniami z 2020 r. Co więcej, w badaniu z 2022 roku zauważono mniejsze zapotrzebowanie na wsparcie emocjonalne i wyższe tendencje do zaprzeczania niż w badaniu z 2020 roku.

The objective of this paper is to present results of the study on the strategies for coping with stress
among students of Polish universities at the end of COVID-19 pandemic, that is, at the beginning of
2022. The Mini-COPE questionnaire was used, which was filled in by 475 students of Polish universities.
The gathered empirical material indicated that in 2022 respondents more often used strategies such as
humor and self-blame, whereas, the frequency of using the strategy related to religious coping turned
out to be lower in comparison with research from 2020. Furthermore, the trend of lower demand for
emotional support and higher trend of denial were noticed in the research from 2022.

results.title: Polyoxyethylene glycol ethers of fatty alcohols used in cloud point extraction of Viola tricolor: Polyphenols solubilization, antioxidant activity studies and molecular dynamic simulations

abstracts.content: The following paper proposes a modern method of obtaining an extract from Viola tricolor L. with a high rutin content and enhanced antioxidant activity. Conventional isolation of active substances from plant raw material is high-cost, elaborate and often harmful to the environment. The ultrasonic assistance micelle-mediated extraction method (UAMME) and the cloud-point extraction/separation technique are interesting alternatives. This work discusses the relationship between salt concentration and the cloud-point extraction (CPE) yield. The molecular dynamic simulations investigated the impact of hydrocarbon chain length and the ratio of oxyethylene/oxypropylene units of model surfactants on the interactions between extraction system components. Micellar extract from the Viola tricolor was obtained using C9-11 Pareth-5 at 1 wt/vol% and subsequently concentrated by CPE with the addition of NaCl in concentrations from 5% to 30%. For comparison, water and ethanol extracts were also prepared. Antioxidant properties, polyphenols and flavonoid contents were measured for all samples. The HPLC method was used to determine the rutin concentration. The simulation part of the study confirmed the dependence of bioflavonoid solubilization efficiency on the surfactant structure. The determined descriptors allowed for finding the optimal structure of the model surfactants and gave a hint for their application to obtain extracts with high concentrations of antioxidants.

results.title: Self‐Deception in Human–AI Emotional Relations
The Doxastic Heuristic and the Consequence Account of the Epistemic Side-Effect Effect

abstracts.content: We discuss two philosophical explanations of the epistemic side-effect effect: the doxastic heuristic account (Alfano et al. The Monist 95 (2): 264–289, 2012) and the consequence account (Paprzycka-Hausman Synthese 197: 5457–5490, 2020). We argue that the doxastic heuristic account has problems with explaining knowledge attributions in cases where the probability that the side effect will occur is low and where the side effect does not ultimately occur. It can explain why there is a difference between the harm and the help cases but it cannot explain why people are willing to attribute knowledge in the harm cases. Such attributions can be explained on the consequence account, which takes knowledge attributions in norm-violation cases to be due to the increased salience of a consequence-awareness claim (knowledge that a possible consequence of the chairman’s action is that the environment would be harmed). We report the results of a new study that tests the predictions of both accounts. In some conditions, people attribute knowledge of the side effect even in cases where the chairman does not have the relevant belief. This result directly contradicts the central tenet of the doxastic heuristic account. Linear regression models of knowledge attribution that correspond to the two accounts were compared. The addition of different justification options significantly contributes to the predictive power of the statistical model. The consequence account can explain the pattern of justifications better than the doxastic heuristic account. Our findings support the consequence account and pose a challenge to the proponents of the doxastic heuristic account.

The changing role of accountants through the lens of university students' perspective

journal.title: Zeszyty Naukowe Politechniki Śląskiej. Seria Organizacja i Zarządzanie

abstracts.content:
Purpose: The article aims to explore final-year undergraduate accounting students' knowledge and awareness of the changing role of accountants in the wake of digitalization. Design/methodology/approach: A survey was conducted among students attending the last semester of specialized undergraduate studies in Poland regarding their state of knowledge and wareness of digitalization-driven change in the role of accountants. The results obtained were further compared with a pilot study conducted among students of master's degree programs.
Findings: The survey showed unequivocally that students are aware of the change in the role of accountants in consequence of digitalization, with no distinction between undergraduate and graduate students, full-time or part-time mode. The respondents indicate the need to possess
and refine digital competencies. The students are familiar with digitalization tools, although to a very varying degree. They recognize the benefits of and barriers to implementing digitalization. They likewise identify new roles for accountants arising from digitalization.
Research limitations/implications: The survey employed the method of selection by convenience, which renders the results obtained non-generalizable to the entire population. Practical implications: The article indicates students' awareness of the changing role of accountants and the need for digital competence in the profession. 
Originality/value: The article allows to partially fill the research gap in empirical studies on the changing role of accountants as a result of digitalization. It also sets the stage for further empirical research on the challenges in academic accounting education, with a focus on digital
transformation.

Additive and subtractive manufacturing of Inconel 718 components – estimation of time, costs and carbon dioxide emission – case study

journal.title: Advances in Science and Technology-Research Journal

abstracts.content:
The article presents the cost analysis of three techniques that can be used to produce a cylindrical part from Inconel
718 nickel alloy. First of them allows the part to be shaped by additive manufacturing (AM). In the second tech-
nique the shape is obtained by forging. Both techniques require the use of machining to give the final dimensional
and shape accuracy of the manufactured part. The third technique is based solely on machining operations. Re-
search has shown that the most expensive technique for high-volume production is SLM/LMF. Based on the case
study, it can be concluded that after a year of production using the SLM/LMF, forging and machining methods,
the carbon dioxide emission is the biggest in the additive manufacturing. Optimizing the Ra and Fc parameters
causes differences in carbon dioxide emissions. The turning process including machining optimization due to Fc
characterizes a higher ability to produce parts than optimization due to roughness parameter Ra.

results.title: Sprawiedliwość versus miłosierdzie. Kilka refleksji z wykorzystaniem teorii trudnych przypadków w ujęciu Jerzego Zajadło

abstracts.content: Opracowanie omawia problematykę relacji między sprawiedliwością a miłosierdziem jako egzemplifikację filozoficznoprawnego trudnego przypadku (hard case). Autor, posługując się teorią trudnych przypadków zaproponowaną przez Jerzego Zajadło, dokonuje przeglądu formułowanych współcześnie stanowisk w ramach sporu między sprawiedliwością a miłosierdziem. Argumentuje zarazem, że istnieje możliwość interpretacji tegoż konfliktu jako trudnego przypadku obejmującego spór między prawem a moralnością, a równocześnie jako wewnętrznego konfliktu prawa z prawem, w zależności od przyjętych założeń filozoficznoprawnych. Wskazuje też, że hard case sprawiedliwość versus miłosierdzie obejmuje wszystkie "wymiary" fenomenu prawa, a nadto, iż jest on szczególnie dyskursywny, chociażby z uwagi na polisemiczność używanych pojęć. W opracowaniu zwrócono także uwagę na współczesne propozycje postulujące integrację miłosierdzia ze sprawiedliwością, które można określić koncepcjami "sprawiedliwości miłosiernej", a które są wyzwaniem dla retrybutywnie zorientowanych koncepcji sprawiedliwości.

In this text, I discuss the issue of the relationship between justice and mercy as an exemplification of a philosophical and legal hard case. In the theory of hard cases proposed by Zajadło, I review contemporary positions in the dispute between justice and mercy. At the same time, I argue that it is possible to interpret this conflict as a hard case involving a dispute between law and morality, and, at the same time, as an internal conflict of law with law, depending on the philosophical and legal assumptions adopted. I also point out that the hard case of justice versus mercy covers all "dimensions" of the law, further that it particularly generates discussion, if only because of the polysemantic nature of the concepts used. I draw attention to contemporary proposals that postulate the integration of mercy with justice, which can be defined as the concepts of "merciful justice", and which are a challenge to retributively oriented concepts of justice.

results.title: Use of artificial intelligence in terms of open innovation process and management
Water consumption rates in indoor swimming pools: analysis of design assumptions in the context of green deal implementation

abstracts.content: A significant part of the operating costs of indoor pools is influenced by the demand for water and the amount of sewage discharged. In Poland, there are no current national guidelines for the design of pool installations. Designers often use the guidelines of the German standard DIN 19643, the application of which in Poland is limited due to construction law regulations. The aim of the work is to analyze design assumptions (guidelines for designing water supply and sewage installations) vs. actual water consumption in a selected Auapark (case study). The analysis takes into account new design solutions (water recovery from washings, rainwater management, new filter design), irregularities in the implementation assumptions (oversized installation diameters), existing operational problems related to appropriate water quality and reference to the seasons (March 2023 - June 2024). It has been shown that the use of modern solutions, consistent with the idea of sustainable development, in the field of water and sewage management allows to significantly reduce the demand for water and sewage discharged in relation to the currently adopted indicators and assumptions in this area. For example: in summer, the consumption of water was 36.3 m3/d, while the projected consumption was 132.5 m3/d.
